meanings.definition: to overwhelm or burden with excessive amounts of something
meanings.sent1: She overgoads her plate with food at every meal.
meanings.sent2: The students overgoad their backpacks with heavy books.
meanings.sent3: He overgoads his schedule with too many activities, leaving no time to relax.
meanings.sent4: The storm overgoads the river, causing it to flood its banks.
meanings.sent5: The company overgoads the market with their new product, saturating it completely.

meanings.definition: overloaded or overwhelmed with excessive amounts of something
meanings.sent1: The overgoads suitcase was too heavy to lift.
meanings.sent2: She felt overgoads with responsibilities at work.
meanings.sent3: The overgoads computer crashed under the weight of too many open programs.
meanings.sent4: The overgoads shelves in the store collapsed under the weight of too many products.
meanings.sent5: The overgoads schedule left no time for rest or relaxation.

meanings.definition: excessive or overwhelming amounts of something
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with overgoads of colorful balloons for the party.
meanings.sent2: She felt overwhelmed by the overgoads of paperwork on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The overgoads of traffic made the commute unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The overgoads of sweets at the buffet table tempted everyone.
meanings.sent5: The overgoads of information in the report was difficult to process.
